review: I bought this device in December 2014 and first few months it worked just fine. I didnt expect this device to be magic box but it was fine for what it was advertised to do. I mostly watched Netflix and sometimes Amazon Prime. Around March/April (3-4 months after I got the device) it started giving me serious problems. While watching a show or movie on Netflix, picture would intermittently flicker and jerk for few seconds after every couple minutes. Then the picture would just jump to current location few seconds later. And finally approximately 3/4th way though the movie, video will stop while the audio keeps going. I have to stop the movie and restart it.Amazon's customer service while usually great, has been absolutely horrendous when it comes to this device. I have had 4 calls with customer service which all pretty much went like this:Call 1: So sorry to hear about this, blah blah blah. Lets clear netflix cache, clear data and uninstall and reinstall app. You should be all set. We will call back in couple of days to check in with you. NO CALL BACK. Issues started again 2-3 days later.Call 2: I called back again a week later and was told the same script again - so sorry this is happening..BLAH BLAH BLAH. We have to go through all the steps again - clear cache again, uninstall app and reinstall. Then additionally, factory reset Fire TV stick. You should be good to go now and we will call back in couple of days to check in. NO CALL BACK. Issues start again within couple of days.Call 3: Same freakin script again - Made me go through all these steps again and told me to try hooking Fire TV Stick without the HDMI extender that came with it. This should fix the issue and we will call back to make sure there is absolutely no issues going forward. Wait for it - NO CALL BACK and issues start again.Call 4 (LAST CALL) on June 22nd - Apparently the agent transferred me to higher level support for fire tv stick or whatever they call it and the agent told me that he is opening a ticket for this and it should be fixed within 24-48 hours. And now it is 3 weeks later with same issues.Its to the point that I dont use this device - it just sits there. I didnt expect this from Amazon and have learned a lesson about never buying Amazon branded hardware, no matter how good a deal it may seem.Expected better from you Amazon.Update (7/18/2015): Oh and the audio is completely out of sync if you are watching HBO Go on Fire stick.

review: The review is for Amazon tech support.  I received my fire stick timely, but the Netflix application was not working correctly. The on screen keyboard to log in was not displaying correctly. After 2 chats and an hour phone call I was told I would be getting a new Fire Stick the next day.  I am disabled and I had to take the old one to a UPS location which was not convenient but I am a good sport.  The next day I got my new stick and it did the same thing.  I figured my own way around the issue after a half hour of deciphering the cryptic on screen keyboard. The technician I spoke with on the phone told me he would be escalating my issue to the development team.  So I emailed support asking if they had found anything yet. I got canned response after canned response from outsourced level 1 helpdesk people who didn't even take the time to read my email .  I tried repeatedly, replying to the email from the technician I spoke with on the phone but got a response from a different person each time.  And it was evident these people did not have a clear command of the English language.  This is the first time I have written a review of something I have purchased here.  I have been buying since 1998 with no problems, and my Kindle and Echo perform well.  But this time they dropped the ball.  I would recommend getting the Roku stick, as I have one for another TV and it performed well without any issues at all.
